titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Kirk Winslow Papers MSS.317
titlestmt.author: Collection processed by Jacqueline Rider

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace 2023-06-13T13:49:53

physdesc.extent: in 11 records cartons, 1 flat box, and 2 oversize folders

did.abstract: Kirk Winslow (1955-2002) was a graduate of New York University's Cinema Studies Program and a filmmaker and photographer with ties to several well-known artists. This collection consists of photos, slides, contact sheets, and negatives Winslow used to create works such as "Postwar," "Democracy in America," and "Cost of Living," plus slides and photos from his international travels and personal life.
did.physloc: Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please contact fales.library@nyu.edu at least two business days prior to your research visit to coordinate access.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The collection was donated by Winslow's estate, facilitated by fellow artists, to New York University after his death. Accession number associated with this donation is 2011.317.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright and related rights to publicity and privacy for materials in this collection were not transferred to New York University. Permission to use materials must be secured from the copyright holder.

phystech.head: Audiovisual Access Policies and Procedures
phystech.p: Audiovisual materials have not been preserved and may not be available to researchers. Materials not yet digitized will need to have access copies made before they can be used. To request an access copy, or if you are unsure if an item has been digitized, please contact fales.library@nyu.edu with the collection name, collection number, and a description of the item(s) requested. A staff member will respond to you with further information.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged into five series by format:

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Kirk Winslow was born in 1955 in Beirut, Lebanon, the son of Maryette Charlton and Hall Winslow. Two years later, his family moved to Manhattan, where he lived most of his life. He attended the Putney School in Vermont and spent time in Europe in the 1970s. He earned a BFA in Cinema Studies from New York University and became a filmmaker and photographer, developing close ties to several well-known artists of the late 20th century.

Winslow published an article on the films of Gregory J. Markopoulos, in whom he had a life-long interest, in Millennium Film Journal in 1998 and presented a Markopoulos retrospective in Germany in 1999. He held a rare public screening of his films at the Robert Beck Memorial Cinema one year before his death. A later series of films by Markopoulos and Robert Beavers was dedicated to Winslow's memory. Kirk Winslow died in Manhattan in 2002.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Published citations should take the following form: Identification of item, date (if known); Kirk Winslow Papers; MSS 317; box number; folder number; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University Libraries.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Materials were arranged by format and placed in new acid-free folders and sleeves. Original order, when present, such as with slides in marked carousels, has been maintained. Original folder labels, when present have been retained. Financial statements, receipts, and other office records were removed.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: The Richard Foreman Papers (MSS 152) contain two films by Kirk Winslow, "Rhoda in Potatoland" and "The Threepenny Opera, Lincoln Center highlights."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Kirk Winslow Papers (1960-2004) document Winslow's creative process and work as a filmmaker and photographer during the late 20th century. Included are slides, photographs, negatives, and contact sheets from his time in Manhattan, the Hamptons, Washington, D.C., and Europe. Also included are audio cassettes that accompany specific slide carousels, photography books inscribed to him, and signed posters.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series I consists of slides for several of Winslow's projects including "Democracy in America", "Cost of Living", and "Post War", plus slides of swans, flowers, clouds, individuals, architecture, objects, and locations in the United States and Europe.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series II contains color and black and white photos of and by Kirk Winslow, including Winslow's copyrighted 1980s photos of Manhattan music club CBGB and performance artist Tim Miller. Also here are photos from Europe and New York City neighborhoods and buildings, plus photos of interiors and furnishings as well as some abstract photos.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series III contains contact sheets, most unmarked and undated, for black and white shots of Manhattan locations, interiors, individuals drama performances, and performance artists. Some sheets are titled "Sunspot" by John Jesurun, the Kitchen, NYC, March 1989. Others are of performance artist Stuart Sherman.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series IV contains color and black and white negatives, most undated and unmarked, of film shot by Winslow.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series V contains processed uncut rolls of film, a few letters, three inscribed photography books, five posters, and four audiocassettes that accompany several of Winslow's slide carousels.
